text: Rainham School for Girls is an 11â€“18 girls, secondary school and sixth form with academy status in Rainham, Gillingham, Kent, England. It is next to the all-boys school, The Howard School and is a Technology College. ==History== It used to be a community school run by Medway Council; the school changed to academy status on 1 March 2011. It is run by The Kemnal Academies Trust. == References == == Other websites == * Category:Schools in Kent
title: Rainham School for Girls
